Message: Add ability to override access token request headers (#603)
Description: Add ability to override access token request headers  This moves the currently hardcoded getAccessTokenResponse into their own method.  This allows children providers to construct their own headers as needed. A perfect example of the necessity of this feature is the newer Pinterest v5 API.  In order to exchange the code for an access token, they require an Authorization header composed of a base64 encoded client_id and client_secret.  Without this change, the Pinterest Provider would need to entirely reimplement the getAccessTokenResponse method.  With this change, the Pinterest Provider could simply: php protected function getTokenHeaders() {     return array_merge(         parent::getTokenHeaders(),         [             'Authorization' => 'Basic ' . base64_encode("{$this->clientId}:{$this->clientSecret}"),         ]     ); }  formatting  Co-authored-by: Taylor Otwell taylor@laravel.com
Message Abstract: Add ability to override access token request headers (#603)
Description Abstract: Add ability to override access token request headers This moves the currently hardcoded getAccessTokenResponse into their own method.  This allows children providers to construct their own headers as needed. A perfect example of the necessity of this feature is the newer Pinterest v5 API.  In order to exchange the code for an access token, they require an Authorization header composed of a base64 encoded client_id and client_secret.  Without this change, the Pinterest Provider would need to entirely reimplement the getAccessTokenResponse method.  With this change, the Pinterest Provider could simply: php protected function getTokenHeaders() {     return array_merge(         parent::getTokenHeaders(),         [             'Authorization' => 'Basic ' . base64_encode("{$this->clientId}:{$this->clientSecret}"),         ]     ); } formatting Co-authored-by: Taylor Otwell taylor@laravel.com

Description: This package has required Composer dependency "guzzlehttp/guzzle": "~6.0" since Socialite 3.0 and Laravel 5.4 (2017 January 15) https://github.com/laravel/socialite/commit/811a7446d869dfdd9625cdfb3fa0b70207805eb2#diff-b5d0ee8c97c7abd7e3fa29b9a27d1780 guzzlehttp/guzzle 7.x removes property GuzzleHttp\ClientInterface::VERSION: https://github.com/guzzle/guzzle/blob/master/UPGRADING.md#60-to-70  This removes code no longer called that will cause issues when dependencies are updated to "guzzlehttp/guzzle": "^6.3|^7.0" like laravel/framework's 6.x & 7.x has now.
Description Abstract: This package has required Composer dependency "guzzlehttp/guzzle": "~6.0" since Socialite 3.0 and Laravel 5.4 (2017 January 15) link guzzlehttp/guzzle 7.x removes property GuzzleHttp\ClientInterface::VERSION: link This removes code no longer called that will cause issues when dependencies are updated to "guzzlehttp/guzzle": "^6.3|^7.0" like laravel/framework's 6.x & 7.x has now.

Description: [5.x] Only use the read_user scope for GitLab by default
Description Abstract: [5.x] Only use the read_user scope for GitLab by default

Message: Only use the read_user scope for GitLab by default
Description: If the user created the application without checking any of the   scope checkboxes, GitLab will implicitly check all the boxes when   submitting the form. This can result in all scopes being granted   to the application, which is very broad.   If the user created the application with only the read_user scope   being grantable to applications, Socialite will work correctly out   of the box (without requiring the user to override the scopes being   requested on the Laravel side).   This closes #402.
Message Abstract: Only use the read_user scope for GitLab by default
Description Abstract: If the user created the application without checking any of the   scope checkboxes, GitLab will implicitly check all the boxes when   submitting the form. This can result in all scopes being granted   to the application, which is very broad. If the user created the application with only the read_user scope   being grantable to applications, Socialite will work correctly out   of the box (without requiring the user to override the scopes being   requested on the Laravel side). This closes #402.

Message: Fix bug with no LinkedIn email addresses
Description: In certain situations it's possible that LinkedIn doesn't returns any email addresses because they're private and not available through the API. At the moment the current provider always expects one so this change allows also to retrieve the user without expecting an email address. Fixes https://github.com/laravel/socialite/issues/347
Message Abstract: Fix bug with no LinkedIn email addresses
Description Abstract: In certain situations it's possible that LinkedIn doesn't returns any email addresses because they're private and not available through the API. At the moment the current provider always expects one so this change allows also to retrieve the user without expecting an email address. Fixes link

Description: This key name was incorrectly changed in https://github.com/laravel/socialite/pull/346
Description Abstract: This key name was incorrectly changed in link

Description: These updates ensure we're using the latest API urls from Google and continue to provide a working app after the shutdown of the Google+ functionality in March 2019. By changing to the new v3 url for the user info retrieval, some of the keys from the response have changed. I've added the mappings to the old keys for the raw user data so nothing should break. These can be removed in v5.0 of Socialite.
Description Abstract: These updates ensure we're using the latest API urls from Google and continue to provide a working app after the shutdown of the Google+ functionality in March 2019. By changing to the new v3 url for the user info retrieval, some of the keys from the response have changed. I've added the mappings to the old keys for the raw user data so nothing should break. These can be removed in v5.0 of Socialite.

Description: Change $scopeSeparator to a space in BitbucketProvider
Description Abstract: Change $scopeSeparator to a space in BitbucketProvider

Message: Change $scopeSeparator to a space in BitbucketProvider
Description: In Bitbucket's implementation of OAuth2, the space character is the delimiter for scopes. When trying to request multiple scopes, the request fails with the callback url having error_description appended to it with the value of 'Unknown scope: ', and then a comma-delimited list of scopes.  After that the listed error variable has a value of invalid_scope.
Message Abstract: Change $scopeSeparator to a space in BitbucketProvider
Description Abstract: In Bitbucket's implementation of OAuth2, the space character is the delimiter for scopes. When trying to request multiple scopes, the request fails with the callback url having error_description appended to it with the value of 'Unknown scope: ', and then a comma-delimited list of scopes.  After that the listed error variable has a value of invalid_scope.

Description: Use Illuminate's RedirectResponse instead of Symfony's
Description Abstract: Use Illuminate's RedirectResponse instead of Symfony's

Message: Use Illuminate's RedirectResponse instead of Symfony's
Description: Illuminate extends Symfony's RedirectResponse with ResponseTrait, which introduces the header() method. By not using Illuminate's RedirectResponse Socialite breaks middlewares that try to add headers to every response (e.g. no-cache headers).
Message Abstract: Use Illuminate's RedirectResponse instead of Symfony's
Description Abstract: Illuminate extends Symfony's RedirectResponse with ResponseTrait, which introduces the header() method. By not using Illuminate's RedirectResponse Socialite breaks middlewares that try to add headers to every response (e.g. no-cache headers).

Message: add "get user profile" from token and secret
Description: The Two/AbstractProvider.php has userFromToken($token) to retrieve user profile from a token. While One/AbstractProvider.php doesn’t have this feature, I added userFromTokenAndSecret($token, $secret) to retrieve user profile from the  token and secret. Tested with Twitter.

Description Abstract: The Two/AbstractProvider.php has userFromToken($token) to retrieve user profile from a token. While One/AbstractProvider.php doesn’t have this feature, I added userFromTokenAndSecret($token, $secret) to retrieve user profile from the  token and secret. Tested with Twitter.

Description: Use the public method to get the scopes
Description Abstract: Use the public method to get the scopes

Message: Use the public method to get the scopes
Description: There may be a scenario when the class can be extended and override the scopes (or add additional ones for example in case of GoogleProvider), example: php <?php use Laravel\Socialite\Two\GoogleProvider; class YoutubeProvider extends GoogleProvider {     public function getScopes()     {         return array_merge(parent::getScopes(), [             'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/youtube.readonly'         ]);     } } }
Message Abstract: Use the public method to get the scopes
Description Abstract: There may be a scenario when the class can be extended and override the scopes (or add additional ones for example in case of GoogleProvider), example: php <?php use Laravel\Socialite\Two\GoogleProvider; class YoutubeProvider extends GoogleProvider {     public function getScopes()     {         return array_merge(parent::getScopes(), [             'link'         ]);     } } }

Description: Google and Facebook require certain scopes to login correctly so they don't throw an error, which are included by default. However, when a user adds their own scopes, it overrides these scopes that they don't know about. This makes it merge them instead.
Description Abstract: Google and Facebook require certain scopes to login correctly so they don't throw an error, which are included by default. However, when a user adds their own scopes, it overrides these scopes that they don't know about. This makes it merge them instead.

Description: No need to specify anything related to "Google +". Some Google Apps accounts may have it disabled or G+ may not be usefull for an account. I have checked the given changes for my own use (Google Apps) and they are working as expected (the mapping is correctly done).
Message Abstract: Replaced G+ by OpenID in scopes
Description Abstract: No need to specify anything related to "Google +". Some Google Apps accounts may have it disabled or G+ may not be usefull for an account. I have checked the given changes for my own use (Google Apps) and they are working as expected (the mapping is correctly done).

Message: Add setting custom request parameters to redirect
Description: Many popular OAuth2 providers accept custom request parameters in order to change the behavior of the authentication flow. This change adds the ability to add on arbitrary custom parameters to the initial OAuth request. The use is similar to that of the `scopes' functionality: $provider     ->scopes(['email'])     ->parameters(['key' => 'value'])     ->redirect();
Message Abstract: Add setting custom request parameters to redirect
Description Abstract: Many popular OAuth2 providers accept custom request parameters in order to change the behavior of the authentication flow. This change adds the ability to add on arbitrary custom parameters to the initial OAuth request. The use is similar to that of the `scopes' functionality: $provider     ->scopes(['email'])     ->parameters(['key' => 'value'])     ->redirect();

Description: Graph API v2.4 requires a fields parameter to return anything beyond id, name, and avatar. This fix sets the default fields to match the default scope request and common user mapping (first_name, last_name, email). Also allows custom fields to be requested instead via the fields() method.
Description Abstract: Graph API v2.4 requires a fields parameter to return anything beyond id, name, and avatar. This fix sets the default fields to match the default scope request and common user mapping (first_name, last_name, email). Also allows custom fields to be requested instead via the fields() method.

Description: Move auth url parameters to own method.
Description Abstract: Move auth url parameters to own method.

Message: Move auth url parameters to own method.
Description: This makes it a bit easier to add any additional parameters needed for building the auth url in a provider. For example, in Facebook you could often have the need to send the "auth_type" parameter for forcing rerequests and reauthentications: // FacebookProvider  protected function getCodeRequestParameters($state) {     return array_merge(parent::getCodeRequestParameters($state), ['auth_type' => 'rerequest']); }
Message Abstract: Move auth url parameters to own method.
Description Abstract: This makes it a bit easier to add any additional parameters needed for building the auth url in a provider. For example, in Facebook you could often have the need to send the "auth_type" parameter for forcing rerequests and reauthentications: // FacebookProvider protected function getCodeRequestParameters($state) {     return array_merge(parent::getCodeRequestParameters($state), ['auth_type' => 'rerequest']); }
